repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  `:Man` shows inacurrate error message when `man`
	  can't be executed

Solution: throw error with better message when `vim.system` fails

Fixes: #33265

Before:
![before - Copy](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3249bd46-95a4-4546-9b65-a13f690d5322)


After:
![afternew - Copy](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e25532b-85a0-49b9-b4ab-0dd6ca93bd29)

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,7 +26,7 @@ end, {
   addr = 'other',
   nargs = '*',
   complete = function(...)
-    return require('man').man_complete(...)
+    return vim.F.npcall(require('man').man_complete, ...)

comment_data.body:
This is a bit clumsy. Maybe `vim.system()` should return a structured object or something, but meanwhile we can use `vim.fn.executable()` to do the check, without string-scraping error messages. Here's some untested sample code:

```lua
if vim.fn.executable(cmd[1]) == 0 then
  error(string.format('not found: "%s"', cmd[1]), 0)
end
local r = vim.system(cmd, { env = env, timeout = 10000 }):wait()
```

If you also want to check access, use `uv.fs_access(cmd[1], 'X')`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,20 @@ local M = {}
 --- @param env? table<string,string|number>
 --- @return string
 local function system(cmd, silent, env)
-  local r = vim.system(cmd, { env = env, timeout = 10000 }):wait()
+  local ok, proc_or_err = pcall(vim.system, cmd, { env = env, timeout = 10000 })
+
+  if not ok then
+    local errmsg = tostring(proc_or_err)
+    if string.find(errmsg, 'ENOENT') then
+      error(string.format("can't find '%s'", cmd[1]), 0)
+    elseif string.find(errmsg, 'EACCES') then

comment_data.body: Let's just do this for all errors. That avoids yet another string.find() on error messages.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,9 +8,15 @@ vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Man', function(params)
   if params.bang then
     man.init_pager()
   else
-    local err = man.open_page(params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
-    if err then
+    local ok, err = pcall(man.open_page, params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
+    if
+      ok
+      or string.find(assert(err), "can't find '%a+'")
+      or string.find(assert(err), "can't access '%a+'")
+    then
       vim.notify('man.lua: ' .. err, vim.log.levels.ERROR)

@@ -20,7 +26,7 @@ end, {
   addr = 'other',
   nargs = '*',
   complete = function(...)
-    return require('man').man_complete(...)
+    return vim.F.npcall(require('man').man_complete, ...)

comment_data.body: Done, structured error objects would be a lot nicer, especially if libuv itself used them.

 --- @return string

-  local r = vim.system(cmd, { env = env, timeout = 10000 }):wait()
+  local ok, proc_or_err = pcall(vim.system, cmd, { env = env, timeout = 10000 })
+
+  if not ok then
+    local errmsg = tostring(proc_or_err)
+    if string.find(errmsg, 'ENOENT') then
+      error(string.format("can't find '%s'", cmd[1]), 0)
+    elseif string.find(errmsg, 'EACCES') then

@@ -8,9 +8,15 @@ vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Man', function(params)
   if params.bang then
     man.init_pager()
   else
-    local err = man.open_page(params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
-    if err then
+    local ok, err = pcall(man.open_page, params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
+    if
+      ok
+      or string.find(assert(err), "can't find '%a+'")
+      or string.find(assert(err), "can't access '%a+'")
+    then
       vim.notify('man.lua: ' .. err, vim.log.levels.ERROR)

comment_data.body:
open_page may return a string error: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ad337025314a424f19f96decb69b6a9d36121efe/runtime/lua/man.lua#L685

but you have now assigned that to `_`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@ vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Man', function(params)
   if params.bang then
     man.init_pager()
   else
-    local err = man.open_page(params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
+    local _, err = pcall(man.open_page, params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)

comment_data.body: how is this helpful ? `man_complete` should make this decision in its own logic, if it's actually needed. shouldn't require pcall() here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -20,7 +20,12 @@ end, {
   addr = 'other',
   nargs = '*',
   complete = function(...)
-    return require('man').man_complete(...)
+    local ok, ret = pcall(require('man').man_complete, ...)
+    if ok then
+      return ret
+    else
+      return nil

comment_data.body:
the example code i gave intentionally used double quotes in the message.
```suggestion
    error(string.format('not found: "%s"', cmd[1]), 0)
  elseif vim.uv.fs_access(cmd[1], 'X') then
    error(string.format('not executable: "%s"', cmd[1]), 0)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,6 +8,12 @@ local M = {}
 --- @param env? table<string,string|number>
 --- @return string
 local function system(cmd, silent, env)
+  if vim.fn.executable(cmd[1]) == 0 then
+    error(string.format("not found: '%s'", cmd[1]), 0)
+  elseif vim.uv.fs_access(cmd[1], 'X') then
+    error(string.format("no permission to execute: '%s'", cmd[1]), 0)

comment_data.body: since pcall returns a status code boolean (assigned to `_`) + the error object / return value of the function, `err` will either be your mentioned string or a lua error message
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@ vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Man', function(params)
   if params.bang then
     man.init_pager()
   else
-    local err = man.open_page(params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
+    local _, err = pcall(man.open_page, params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)

@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@ vim.api.nvim_create_user_command('Man', function(params)
   if params.bang then
     man.init_pager()
   else
-    local err = man.open_page(params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)
+    local _, err = pcall(man.open_page, params.count, params.smods, params.fargs)

comment_data.body: I added this since, if on a Release build, nvim completely crashes without any error message if the completion function throws an error. But i will move this into `man_complete`, unless this behaviour is intentional?

-    return require('man').man_complete(...)
+    local ok, ret = pcall(require('man').man_complete, ...)
+    if ok then
+      return ret
+    else
+      return nil

sounds bad... mind creating an issue?

comment_regular_data.body: Git push to origin failed for release-0.11 with exitcode 1

I just realised the access check doesnt work since we're not passing the full path of the command and we're not inverting the boolean. Only has an impact on windows since `vim.fn.exectuable` also checks for executability on linux. will make another pr

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(man.lua): provide better error message when failing to execute man
